meanings.definition: A person or thing that closely resembles another, especially in appearance.
meanings.sent1: My friend has a lookalike who works at the same store.
meanings.sent2: The celebrity had a lookalike who would attend events on their behalf.
meanings.sent3: At the costume party, there were two lookalikes dressed as twins.
meanings.sent4: The two paintings were such a lookalike that it was hard to tell them apart.
meanings.sent5: The detective mistook the suspect's lookalike for the real criminal.

meanings.sent1: The lookalike dolls on the shelf were identical.
meanings.sent2: The new car model was a lookalike of the previous year's version.
meanings.sent3: The cake was so perfectly lookalike to the picture on the box.
meanings.sent4: The fake designer bag was a lookalike of the original, but at a fraction of the cost.
meanings.sent5: The twins were so lookalike that even their own parents sometimes mixed them up.
